contentrichtext.text: {{Use Australian English|date=July 2011}} {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = Bouddi National Park | iucn_category = II | image = Australia_Locator_Map.svg | caption = | locator_x = 253 | locator_y = 168 | nearest_town_or_city = [[Killcare, New South Wales|Killcare]] | coordinates = {{Coord|33|31|00|S|151|24|00|E|type:landmark_region:AU}} | area = 1,532 ha<ref name="ParkAreas">{{cite journal|title=Department of Environment Climate Change and Water Annual Report 2009-10|publisher=Department of Environment Climate Change and Water|date=November 2010|issn=1838-5958|pages=274â€“275|url=http://www.environment.nsw.gov.au/whoweare/deccwar10.htm}}</ref> | established = 1 October 1967 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = [[National Parks and Wildlife Service (New South Wales)|NSW National Parks and Wildlife Service]] | official_site = [http://www.environment.nsw.gov.au/NationalParks/parkHome.aspx?id=N0005 Bouddi National Park] }} '''Bouddi National Park''' is located on the [[Central Coast (New South Wales)|Central Coast]] of [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]], 46 km northeast of [[Sydney]].<ref name=DistfromSyd>{{cite web|url=http://www.ga.gov.au/bin/distancedraw2?rec1=39923&placename=bouddi&placetype=0&state=0&place1=SYDNEY&place1long=151.209595&place1lat=-33.873199|title=Great Circle Distance between SYDNEY and BOUDDI NATIONAL PARK|accessdate=11 August 2011|publisher=Commonwealth of Australia|work=Geosciences Australia website}}</ref> A section of the national park extends into the sea creating fully protected land, shore and marine habitats. The Park contains one of the last temperate rainforests on the Central Coast, [[Fletchers Glen]]. Bouddi National Park was originally known as ''Bouddi Natural Park''. It received its name at the second meeting of the park trust held on 5 July 1936. Other names considered were ''Maitland Bay Park'', ''Cape Three Points Reserve'' and ''Gerrinbombi Park''. The reason for the choice was that ''Bouddi'' is the authenticated aboriginal name of the most conspicuous feature of the district and appears on maps as early as 1828. Bouddi is the Aboriginal word for the heart.<ref>Bennett p17</ref> The trust had been founded the year earlier to manage the reserve and had representation from the ''NSW Federation of Bushwalking Clubs'' and [[Erina Shire Council]]. In 1967, the park (by then totalling about 1310 acres) was dedicated as a national park under the newly passed legislation and was renamed ''Bouddi State Park''. Its management became the responsibility of the [[National Parks and Wildlife Service (New South Wales)|NSW National Parks and Wildlife Service]], and soon afterwards the trust was reconstituted as an advisory committee. On 1 January 1974, the National Parks and Wildlife Act dispensed with the category of ''State'' parks and Bouddi was renamed ''Bouddi National Park''.<ref>Pratt p4</ref> ==See also== {{Commons category}} * [[Protected areas of New South Wales (Australia)]] ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==References== {{Refbegin}} *{{Cite book | editor = F. C. Bennett | year = 1981 | title = The Story of the Aboriginal People of the Central Coast of New South Wales | publisher = Brisbane Water Historical Society and The Entrance and District Historical Society (Jointly) }} *{{Cite book | editor = Pratt, Eileen | year = 1978 | title = Place Names of the Central Coast | publisher = Brisbane Water Historical Society and The Entrance and District Historical Society (Jointly) }} {{Refend}} {{National Parks of New South Wales}} {{The Hawkesbury River}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2011}} [[Category:National parks of New South Wales]] [[Category:Central Coast (New South Wales)]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1967]] [[Category:1967 establishments in Australia]] {{NewSouthWales-protected-area-stub}}
